meanings.definition: To move slowly and quietly in order to avoid being noticed.
meanings.sent1: The cat crept up to the bird feeder to catch a snack.
meanings.sent2: She crept out of the room so as not to wake the sleeping baby.
meanings.sent3: The sneaky mouse crept into the pantry to steal some cheese.
meanings.sent4: The fog crept over the city, enveloping it in a mysterious haze.
meanings.sent5: As the sun set, darkness crept slowly across the land.

meanings.definition: To have moved slowly and quietly in order to avoid being noticed.
meanings.sent1: The thief had crept into the house undetected.
meanings.sent2: They had crept past the guard and into the forbidden chamber.
meanings.sent3: The ninja had crept through the shadows, unseen by his enemies.
meanings.sent4: Time had crept by so slowly during the boring lecture.
meanings.sent5: The ivy had crept up the old stone wall, adding a touch of green to the gray surface.
